query.prompt:

query.result: 25 My naked flesh was of little to me, 26 that she made me enter within that wall, 27 to draw from it a spirit of Judas's circle.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
28 Quell’ è ’l più basso loco e ’l più oscuro, 29 e ’l più lontan dal ciel che tutto gira: 30 ben so ’l cammin; però ti fa sicuro.
query.result: 28 That is the lowest place and the darkest, 29 and the most distant from the sky that all turns: 30 I know the path well; however it makes you safe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
31 Questa palude che ’l gran puzzo spira 32 cigne dintorno la città dolente, 33 u’ non potemo intrare omai sanz’ ira».

query.prompt:

40 and with very green hydras they were girded; 41 little serpents and waxen things they had for hair, 42 where the fierce temples were winding.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
61 O voi ch’avete li ’ntelletti sani, 62 mirate la dottrina che s’asconde 63 sotto ’l velame de li versi strani.
query.result: 61 O you who have sound intellects, 62 behold the doctrine that hides 63 under the veil of the strange verses.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
64 E già venìa su per le torbide onde 65 un fracasso d’un suon, pien di spavento, 66 per cui tremavano amendue le sponde,
67 non altrimenti fatto che d’un vento 68 impetüoso per li avversi ardori, 69 che fier la selva e sanz’ alcun rattento
70 li rami schianta, abbatte e porta fori; 71 dinanzi polveroso va superbo, 72 e fa fuggir le fiere e li pastori.
query.result:
64 And already rose up on the murky waves 65 a crash of a sound, full of fright, 66 by which both banks trembled,
67 no otherwise made than by a wind 68 impetuous for the opposing ardors, 69 that fierce the forest and without any hesitation
70 the branches shatter, strike down and carry out; 71 ahead dusty goes proud, 72 and makes the beasts and the shepherds flee.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
73 Li occhi mi sciolse e disse: «Or drizza il nerbo 74 del viso su per quella schiuma antica 75 per indi ove quel fummo è più acerbo».
query.result: 73 The eyes loosened me and said: “Now raise the nerve 74 of the face up through that ancient foam 75 where that smoke is more unripe”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.

query.result:
76 Like the frogs before the enemy 77 snakes through the water all disappear, 78 until each one clings to the earth,

query.prompt:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
88 Ahi quanto mi parea pien di disdegno! 89 Venne a la porta e con una verghetta 90 l’aperse, che non v’ebbe alcun ritegno.
query.result: 88 Ah, how it seemed to me full of disdain! 89 He came to the door and with a little rod 90 opened it, which had no restraint.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
91 «O cacciati del ciel, gente dispetta», 92 cominciò elli in su l’orribil soglia, 93 «ond’ esta oltracotanza in voi s’alletta?
94 Perché recalcitrate a quella voglia 95 a cui non puote il fin mai esser mozzo, 96 e che più volte v’ha cresciuta doglia?
97 Che giova ne le fata dar di cozzo? 98 Cerbero vostro, se ben vi ricorda, 99 ne porta ancor pelato il mento e ’l gozzo».
query.result:
91 O exiles of heaven, spiteful people, 92 he began upon the horrible threshold, 93 where this extravagance in you delights?
94 Why do you recoil from that desire 95 to which the end can never be a novice, 96 and that many times has increased your grief?
97 What good is it in the fates to give a shell? 98 Your Cerberus, if it well remembers you, 99 still brings it bald the chin and the throat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
100 Poi si rivolse per la strada lorda, 101 e non fé motto a noi, ma fé sembiante 102 d’omo cui altra cura stringa e morda
103 che quella di colui che li è davante; 104 e noi movemmo i piedi inver’ la terra, 105 sicuri appresso le parole sante.
query.result:

103 that of the one who is before them; 104 and we moved our feet toward the earth, 105 securely following the holy words.
